intro: Stylocoryna hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy stylocoryna, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Stylocoryna hirsuta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
